Google was added to the [[Standard & Poor's]] 500 index ([[S&P 500]]) on [[March 31]], [[2006]]. Google replaced [[Burlington Resources]], a major oil producer based in [[Houston]] which was acquired by [[ConocoPhillips]].
Google was added to the [[Standard & Poor's]] 500 index ([[S&P 500]]) on [[March 31]], [[2006]]. Google replaced [[Burlington Resources]], a major oil producer based in [[Houston]] which was acquired by [[ConocoPhillips]].
â
On a sociological note, the growth of Google has made an impact on urban language, with phrases such as "Google it" becoming general references to searching for information on the internet.
+
On a sociological note, the growth of Google has made an impact on urban language, with phrases such as "Google it" becoming general references to searching for information on the internet. Another term called "Google whacking" has become somewhat of a game in which people try to enter search words or phrases that only show one result.
:''See also: [[History of Google#Criticism and controversy|Recent criticisms and controversies]]''
:''See also: [[History of Google#Criticism and controversy|Recent criticisms and controversies]]''
